newsitem.title: UK: Details of British government action on guns.
newsitem.headline: Details of British government action on guns.

text.p: The British government on Wednesday announced it was banning almost all handguns after an inquiry into the massacre of 16 Scottish schoolchildren and their teacher by a crazed gunman in March.
The government's response to the inquiry by the senior judge, Lord Douglas Cullen, included the following moves:
- The government will ban all handguns of more than .22 calibre. This will mean that at least 160,000 guns -- 80 percent of those legally held now -- will be destroyed.
- All handguns will be banned from people's homes. Low calibre handguns used for target shooting -- an Olympic sport -- will have to be used and kept in clubs.

- Clubs will have to be licensed after meeting tough, new security limits. "Some handgun clubs may never be able to achieve an adequate level of security. If so they will have to close," Home Secretary Michael Howard said.

- As "few, if any, existing gun clubs will be able to meet these requirements", all owners of low calibre handguns will have to hand them in to police for safekeeping until they can find a licensed club which they can join.
- Possessing a low calibre handgun outside a licensed club will carry a maximum penalty of 10 years' imprisonment.
- Mail order selling of guns will be banned. It will also be an offence to sell or destroy a gun without notifying police.
- "Expanding" -- or dum-dum -- ammunition, used in the Dunblane massacre, will be banned except for tightly controlled deer hunting.
- The government will tighten requirements for firearms certificates, including limiting the grounds for appeal, and make it easier for police to revoke a certificate.
- School security will be tightened. The government will introduce grants to help schools pay for this.
- Voluntary youth organisations will be able to check the suitability of leaders and workers, including the possibility of access to criminal records and other police information.
Thomas Hamilton, responsible for the massacre, was an ex-scout leader who ran keep-fit classes and camps for young boys.
